title: What is motion capture technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Motion capture technology or mocap is a technology used by animators and video editors to use real body motions to animate 3D models , be it for a movie or a game. In simpler terms , a person is made to wear a mocap suit and move around / perform actions (like action scenes) and a computer tracks this suit so that the 3D models perform the same actions as the person wearing the suit. Example : Check out the making of the cutscenes of Arkham Origin , all the animated fights were mocaped.
If you take pictures or snapshot of an moving object that is called motion capture technology. It used various fields like photography, science experiments, medical tests etc.
